title: Types of Stroke
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: What Are the Types of Strokes?
content: Strokes are medical emergencies that stop or interrupt the flow of blood to the brain. The five types are:
What are the warning signs for a stroke?
Think of the word F-A-S-T to help you spot stroke signs and know when to call 911 for yourself or someone else:
bullets: Face drooping: One side of the face droops or is numb. Your smile is uneven or lopsided.
Arm weakness: One arm is weak or numb. One arm drifts downward when you try to raise both arms.
Speech difficulty: Speech is slurred. You're unable to speak or hard to understand.
Time to call 911: If you have any of these signs, even if they go away, call 911 and get to a hospital immediately.

What are the warning signs for a stroke?
Think of the word F-A-S-T to help you spot stroke signs and know when to call 911 for yourself or someone else:
associated_bullets: Face drooping: One side of the face droops or is numb. Your smile is uneven or lopsided.
Arm weakness: One arm is weak or numb. One arm drifts downward when you try to raise both arms.
Speech difficulty: Speech is slurred. You're unable to speak or hard to understand.
Time to call 911: If you have any of these signs, even if they go away, call 911 and get to a hospital immediately.

sections.heading: Ischemic Stroke
content: An ischemic stroke happens when a blood vessel supplying blood to your brain gets blocked by a blood clot. Most strokes are this type.

content_blocks.text: An ischemic stroke happens when a blood vessel supplying blood to your brain gets blocked by a blood clot. Most strokes are this type.

sections.heading: Symptoms of ischemic stroke
content: The symptoms depend on which parts of your brain are affected. They can include things like:
Causes of ischemic stroke

A fatty substance called plaque collects in your arteries and narrows them. This process is called atherosclerosis , and it slows the flow of blood. Plaque breaks off and lots of cells come to the rescue causing a clot and blocking blood flow through the artery.
Besides atherosclerosis, other things that can raise your chances of getting an ischemic stroke are:
Types of ischemic stroke
There are two main types of ischemic stroke:
bullets: Sudden numbness or weakness of your face, arm, or leg, often on one side of the body
Dizziness , loss of balance or coordination, or trouble walking
Injury to blood vessels in your neck
Thrombotic strokes . They're caused by a blood clot that forms in an artery that supplies blood to your brain, also called an atherosclerotic stroke.

Embolic strokes. They happen when a clot forms somewhere else in your body and travels through the blood vessels to your brain. It gets stuck there and stops the flow of your blood. Atrial fibrillation increases the risk of clots forming in the heart that can then travels to the brain.

Dizziness , loss of balance or coordination, or trouble walking

sections.heading: Risk factors of ischemic stroke
content: You're more likely to have an ischemic stroke if you:
Complications of ischemic stroke

Sometimes you can get complications. A stroke damages your brain cells. The more damage that's done, the more problems you can have. That's why it's important to get medical help as soon as possible because there's a limited time for treating an acute stroke. If you don't get treatment, you could have trouble like:
bullets: Have high blood pressure , heart disease , high cholesterol , or diabetes
Have a family history of strokes
Permanent weakness or numbness or garbled speech

content_blocks.text: You're more likely to have an ischemic stroke if you:
associated_bullets: Have high blood pressure , heart disease , high cholesterol , or diabetes
Have a family history of strokes

associated_bullets: Permanent weakness or numbness or garbled speech

sections.heading: Transient Ischemic Attack or Mini-Stroke
content: Ischemic strokes also include something called a "mini-stroke" or a TIA (transient ischemic attack). This is a temporary blockage in blood flow to your brain. The symptoms usually last for just a few minutes or may go away in 24 hours.
Symptoms of TIA
The symptoms may be similar to an ischemic stroke. You might have:
bullets: Numbness/weakness on one side of your body

content_blocks.text: Ischemic strokes also include something called a "mini-stroke" or a TIA (transient ischemic attack). This is a temporary blockage in blood flow to your brain. The symptoms usually last for just a few minutes or may go away in 24 hours.
Symptoms of TIA
The symptoms may be similar to an ischemic stroke. You might have:
associated_bullets: Numbness/weakness on one side of your body

content: Causes and risk factors of TIA are the same as in an ischemic stroke. A TIA can sometimes be a warning sign that you'll have an ischemic stroke soon.
Don't take chances if you or someone you know has any symptoms that seem like a stroke. Get medical help in a hurry.

content_blocks.text: Causes and risk factors of TIA are the same as in an ischemic stroke. A TIA can sometimes be a warning sign that you'll have an ischemic stroke soon.
Don't take chances if you or someone you know has any symptoms that seem like a stroke. Get medical help in a hurry.

sections.heading: Hemorrhagic Stroke
content: These happen when bleeding in your brain damages nearby cells.
Causes and risk factors for hemorrhagic stroke
The common factors are:
There are two types of hemorrhagic stroke. Which kind you have is based on where the bleeding happens.
bullets: Have high cholesterol, high blood pressure, or diabetes that isn’t under control
Have had a stroke in the past
Have a family history of strokes
Have an aneurysm (a weak area in a blood vessel that breaks open)
Subarachnoid hemorrhage means it happened in the area between your brain and skull.
Intracerebral hemorrhage is bleeding inside the brain.

content_blocks.text: These happen when bleeding in your brain damages nearby cells.

bullets: Have high cholesterol, high blood pressure, or diabetes that isn’t under control

Subarachnoid hemorrhage means it happened in the area between your brain and skull.

sections.heading: Symptoms of hemorrhagic stroke
content: Hemorrhagic stroke symptoms usually increase gradually over minutes or a few hours, although a subarachnoid hemorrhage may come on suddenly. You might notice:
Complications of hemorrhagic stroke
A hemorrhagic stroke can cause complications like:
bullets: Intense headache -- some people describe it as the worst headache they've ever had
Swallowing problems and trouble eating and drinking

content_blocks.text: Hemorrhagic stroke symptoms usually increase gradually over minutes or a few hours, although a subarachnoid hemorrhage may come on suddenly. You might notice:
associated_bullets: Intense headache -- some people describe it as the worst headache they've ever had

A hemorrhagic stroke can cause complications like:
associated_bullets: Swallowing problems and trouble eating and drinking

sections.heading: Brain Stem Stroke
content: This type happens in your brain stem. It can affect both sides of the body. If this happens, you’re left in a “locked in” state where you’re unable to speak or move below the neck.
Symptoms of brain stem stroke

It can be hard to recognize when someone is having a brain stem stroke. They may have some symptoms without the hallmark sign of weakness on one side of the body. Symptoms of brain stem stroke include:
bullets: Vertigo, dizziness and loss of balance
Trouble with central nervous system functions like blood pressure and breathing
“Locked in” syndrome -- you can only move your eyes

content_blocks.text: This type happens in your brain stem. It can affect both sides of the body. If this happens, you’re left in a “locked in” state where you’re unable to speak or move below the neck.
Symptoms of brain stem stroke

It can be hard to recognize when someone is having a brain stem stroke. They may have some symptoms without the hallmark sign of weakness on one side of the body. Symptoms of brain stem stroke include:
associated_bullets: Vertigo, dizziness and loss of balance
Trouble with central nervous system functions like blood pressure and breathing
“Locked in” syndrome -- you can only move your eyes

sections.heading: Causes and risk factors of brain stem stroke
content: Causes include:
Risk factors include:
What makes this stroke unique is the location. It's in a very tight small spot that controls vital functions so the consequences are often devastating, including high risk of death.
bullets: Injury to an artery due to sudden head or neck movements (these are rare)

meta_description: WebMD explains the causes and symptoms of the major kinds of stroke.
